chapter.title: Storage Domains
chapter.para:
The storage domain specific elements which may be contained in the storage domain description are as follows:
type One of DATA, ISO or EXPORT
status One of ACTIVE, INACTIVE, LOCKED, MIXED, UNATTACHED and UNINITIALIZED
storage Describes the underlying storage of the storage domain. See below.
master true if this is the master storage domain of a data center
link rel="attachments" A link to the attachments collection representing which data centers the storage domain is attached to. See
host A reference to the host on which this storage domain should be initialized. The only restriction on this host is that it should have access to the physical storage specified.
The storage element has a type element with the physical storage type and a number of elements specific to that storage type. The NFS specific elements are:
address The host name or IP address of the NFS server
path The path of NFS mountable directory on the server
For example:
When creating a new storage domain, the name, type, storage and host elements are required. Only the name element may be updated post-creation.
Once a storage domain has been initialized it can be attached to a data center. See .
The storage domain actions block may report the availability of a teardown action, which must be invoked before the storage domain can be deleted.

section.title: Teardown Action
section.para: The teardown removes the storage domain from the physcail storage. A host which has physical access to the storage must be supplied.
A storage domain must be detached from all data centers before it can be torn down. See .

section.title: Storage Domain Attachments
section.para: A storage domain must be attached to a data center before it can be used. This is done by posting a representation of the attachment to the storage domain's attachments collection.

Attachments are similar to other resources, with the exception that they have no name element and cannot be modified using PUT. The attachment specific properties include:
data_center A reference to the data center which this storage domain is attached. See
storage_domain A reference to the storage domain
status Either ACTIVE or INACTIVE
master true if this is the master storage domain of the data center
For example:
When creating a new attachment, a data_center id must be supplied. An example of attaching a storage domain to a data center:

section.para: There are two possible actions for storage domain attachments - activate and deactivate.

section.title: Activate Action
section.para: A storage domain attachment must be activated before it the storage domain may be used. The activate action does not take any action specific parameters.

section.title: Deactivate Action
section.para: A storage domain attachment must be deactivated before it can be removed. The deactivate action does not take any action specific parameters.
